title: Bog body
data:
***Version [0.26](/0.26 "0.26")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| bog body n [![Bog body.png](/images/0/09/Bog_body.png)](/File:Bog_body.png) |                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |

| [Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")                                     | [rF+](/Fire "Fire") [rC+](/Cold "Cold") [rPois+++](/Poison "Poison") [rDrown](/Asphyxiation "Asphyxiation") [rMiasma](/Miasma "Miasma") [rN+++](/Negative_energy "Negative energy") [rTorm](/Torment "Torment") |

|   |                                                                                                   |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | An undead figure preserved by the brackish waters of a bog, and reanimated by some unknown magic. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Bog bodies** are amphibious [undead](/Undead "Undead") found in [the Swamp](/The_Swamp "The Swamp") with a cold touch-based attack that deals an additional 10-29 cold damage, as well as a few spells. They can swim, but slowly.

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                     |                                                     |
| :---------- | --------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Bolt of Cold](/Bolt_of_Cold "Bolt of Cold") (3d18) | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Slow](/Slow "Slow")                                | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- If you don't have great cold resistance, try not to stay in/above water near a bog body. Bolt of Cold will create [freezing vapours](/Freezing_vapour "Freezing vapour") when passing over water, increasing the damage you'll take.
- The extra cold damage in melee is very likely to trigger unless you have a lot of AC, given the attack's base damage of 20.

## History

- In [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), their touch attack was merged with the main attack, which increased the chance to deal additional cold damage. Also, their HD was increased from 6 to 10, making their spells more powerful.
- Prior to [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), followers of [Fedhas Madash](/Fedhas_Madash "Fedhas Madash") could instantly destroy them with the Fungal Bloom ability.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), you could meet several **decayed bog bodies** in the [Ossuary](/Ossuary "Ossuary"). They were less durable and had [Throw Frost](/Throw_Frost "Throw Frost") instead of [Bolt of Cold](/Bolt_of_Cold "Bolt of Cold"). Decayed bog bodies were replaced with less dangerous [bog mummies](/Mummy_\(monster\)#Variant_Mummy "Mummy (monster)").
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), bog bodies would randomly start rotting.
- Bog bodies were added in [0.11](/0.11 "0.11"), replacing [bog mummies](/Bog_mummies "Bog mummies").
html:
Bog body

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.26: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
bog body n 
HP 25-52
HD 10
XP 685
Speed 10 (swim: 140%)
AC 1
EV 9
Will 40
Attack1 20 (touch: cold)


Resistances rF+
rC+
rPois+++
rDrown
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
Vulnerabilities Holy
Habitat Amphibious
Intelligence Human
Uses Open doors
Holiness Undead
Size Medium
Type ghoul, bog body
Flags Evil
Unbreathing
No zombie
An undead figure preserved by the brackish waters of a bog, and reanimated by some unknown magic.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Bog bodies are amphibious undead found in the Swamp with a cold touch-based attack that deals an additional 10-29 cold damage, as well as a few spells. They can swim, but slowly.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Bolt of Cold (3d18) Wizard flag
Slot2 Slow Wizard flag

Tips & Tricks

  • If you don't have great cold resistance, try not to stay in/above water near a bog body. Bolt of Cold will create freezing vapours when passing over water, increasing the damage you'll take.
  • The extra cold damage in melee is very likely to trigger unless you have a lot of AC, given the attack's base damage of 20.

History

  • In 0.26, their touch attack was merged with the main attack, which increased the chance to deal additional cold damage. Also, their HD was increased from 6 to 10, making their spells more powerful.
  • Prior to 0.24, followers of Fedhas Madash could instantly destroy them with the Fungal Bloom ability.
  • Prior to 0.19, you could meet several decayed bog bodies in the Ossuary. They were less durable and had Throw Frost instead of Bolt of Cold. Decayed bog bodies were replaced with less dangerous bog mummies.
  • Prior to 0.15, bog bodies would randomly start rotting.
  • Bog bodies were added in 0.11, replacing bog mummies.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Bog_body&oldid=74525"

rawPage:
{{version026}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Bog bodies''' are amphibious [[undead]] found in [[the Swamp]] with a cold touch-based attack that deals an additional 10-29 cold damage, as well as a few spells. They can swim, but slowly.

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*If you don't have great cold resistance, try not to stay in/above water near a bog body. Bolt of Cold will create [[freezing vapour]]s when passing over water, increasing the damage you'll take.
*The extra cold damage in melee is very likely to trigger unless you have a lot of AC, given the attack's base damage of 20.

==History==
*In [[0.26]], their touch attack was merged with the main attack, which increased the chance to deal additional cold damage. Also, their HD was increased from 6 to 10, making their spells more powerful.
*Prior to [[0.24]], followers of [[Fedhas Madash]] could instantly destroy them with the Fungal Bloom ability.
*Prior to [[0.19]], you could meet several '''decayed bog bodies''' in the [[Ossuary]]. They were less durable and had [[Throw Frost]] instead of [[Bolt of Cold]]. Decayed bog bodies were replaced with less dangerous [[Mummy (monster)#Variant Mummy|bog mummies]].
*Prior to [[0.15]], bog bodies would randomly start rotting.
*Bog bodies were added in [[0.11]], replacing [[bog mummies]].
